Wright, Frank Lloyd (American architect, 1867-1959) [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: "...also known as "Airplane" House, is a Frank Lloyd Wright designed Prairie school home that was constructed in Madison, Wisconsin in 1908. The client, Eugene Allen Gilmore, served as faculty at the nearby University of Wisconsin Law School from 1902 to 1922. It is located within the University Heights Historic District." -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eugene_A._Gilmore_House [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
